meanings.definition: The quality of being suitable for living in.
meanings.sent1: The liveability of the neighborhood is excellent, with parks and schools nearby.
meanings.sent2: People consider the liveability of a city before deciding to move there.
meanings.sent3: I heard a joke about the liveability of a house that had a tree growing through the roof!
meanings.sent4: The liveability of the town was like a warm hug, welcoming everyone with open arms.
meanings.sent5: The liveability of the apartment complex was so high that it felt like a dream come true.

meanings.definition: The degree to which a place is suitable or good for living in.
meanings.sent1: The liveability of the area was affected by the lack of public transportation.
meanings.sent2: City planners aim to improve the liveability of urban spaces for residents.
meanings.sent3: I never realized how important the liveability of a home was until I had to live in a cramped space.
meanings.sent4: The liveability of the small town was like a breath of fresh air compared to the bustling city.
meanings.sent5: The liveability of the neighborhood was so high that it felt like a paradise on earth.
